qas.question: What greatly reduced the size of Germany after WWI?
Who was relocated during the second world war from the Soviet Union?
What is the German translation for German-Austria?
Who's influence increased after World War I?
During what war did Germans relocate to the Soviet Union?
What country was split among language groups?

context: Following the defeat in World War I, influence of <b4_0>German-speaking elites<b4_0/> over Central and Eastern Europe was greatly limited. At <b5_0>the <a0_0>treaty of Versailles<b5_0/><a0_0/> Germany was substantially reduced in size. Austria-Hungary was split up. Rump-Austria, which to a certain extent corresponded to the German-speaking areas of <b7_0>Austria-Hungary<b7_0/> (a complete split into language groups was impossible due to multi-lingual areas and language-exclaves) adopted the name "<a2_0>German-Austria<a2_0/>" (German: <a3_0>Deutschösterreich<a3_0/>). The name German-Austria was forbidden by the victorious powers of World War I. <a1_0>Volga Germans<a1_0/> living in the Soviet Union were interned in gulags or forcibly relocated during the <b6_0>Second World War.
